metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 16 axioms covering temporal topology, eventuality-time relations, temporal ordering, durations, periodicity, and rates
metadata.notation: First-order logic with temporal entities, interval relations, and temporal measurement

axioms.title: Begins Argument Constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (t1 t2) (if (begins t1 t2) (and (instant t1) (or (temporalEntity t2)(tseq t2)(eventuality t2)))))
axioms.english: The begins relation requires an instant as first argument and allows temporal entities, temporal sequences, or eventualities as second argument.

axioms.title: Ends Argument Constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (t1 t2) (if (ends t1 t2) (and (instant t1) (or (temporalEntity t2)(tseq t2)(eventuality t2)))))
axioms.english: The ends relation requires an instant as first argument and allows temporal entities, temporal sequences, or eventualities as second argument.

axioms.title: InsideTime Argument Constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (t1 t2) (if (insideTime t1 t2) (and (instant t1) (or (temporalEntity t2)(tseq t2)(eventuality t2)))))
axioms.english: The insideTime relation requires an instant as first argument and allows temporal entities, temporal sequences, or eventualities as second argument.

axioms.title: Instant Beginning Identity
axioms.fol: (forall (t1 t2) (if (and (instant t2)(begins t1 t2)) (equal t1 t2)))
axioms.english: The beginning of an instant is itself.

axioms.title: Instant End Identity
axioms.fol: (forall (t1 t2) (if (and (instant t2)(ends t1 t2)) (equal t1 t2)))
axioms.english: The end of an instant is itself.

axioms.title: Interval Between Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (t t1 t2) (iff (intervalBetween t t1 t2) (exists (t3 t4) (and (ends t3 t1)(begins t4 t2) (begins t3 t)(ends t4 t)))))
axioms.english: An interval t between two temporal entities t1 and t2 is an interval that begins at the end of t1 and ends at the beginning of t2.

axioms.title: Positive Infinite Interval Definition
axioms.english: A positively infinite interval is one that has no end.

axioms.title: Proper Interval Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (t) (iff (properInterval t) (or (exists (t1 t2) (and (begins t1 t)(ends t2 t)(nequal t1 t2))) (posInfInterval t))))
axioms.english: A proper interval has distinct beginning and end points, or is positively infinite.

axioms.title: Temporal Sequence Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (s) (iff (tseq s) (and (forall (t) (if (member t s)(temporalEntity t))) (forall (t1 t2) (if (and (member t1 s)(member t2 s)) (and (or (equal t1 t2)(before t1 t2) (before t2 t1)) (if (before t1 t2) (exists (t3) (and (not (member t3 s)) (before t1 t3) (before t3 t2)))))))))))
axioms.english: A temporal sequence is a set of nonoverlapping temporal entities with gaps between distinct members.

axioms.title: AtTime Argument Constraints
axioms.english: The atTime relation requires an eventuality and an instant as arguments.

axioms.title: During Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (e t) (iff (during e t) (and (eventuality e)(properInterval t) (forall (t1) (if (insideTime t1 t)(atTime e t1))))))
axioms.english: An eventuality occurs during an interval if it exists at every instant inside the interval.

axioms.title: Change Temporal Constraint
axioms.english: In change, final states cannot happen before initial states.

axioms.title: Causation Temporal Constraint
axioms.english: An effect cannot happen before its cause.

axioms.title: Enable Temporal Constraint
axioms.english: An enabled effect cannot happen before its enabling condition.

axioms.title: Causal Complex Temporal Effect
axioms.fol: (forall (s e t1) (if (and (causalComplex s e) (forall (e1)(if (member e1 s)(atTime e1 t1)))) (exists (t2) (and (not (before t2 t1))(atTime e t2)))))
axioms.english: If all eventualities in a causal complex happen at time t1, then the effect happens at some time t2 not before t1.

axioms.title: Causal Modus Ponens
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2 t1) (if (and (cause e1 e2)(atTime e1 t1)(etc)) (exists (t2) (and (not (before t2 t1))(atTime e2 t2)))))
axioms.english: If e1 happens and e1 causes e2, then e2 happens (defeasibly) - causal modus ponens.

conversion_notes.temporal_framework: Comprehensive temporal ontology distinguishing instants, intervals, and temporal sequences
conversion_notes.eventuality_integration: Systematic integration of eventualities with temporal framework through timeSpanOf and related predicates
conversion_notes.interval_algebra: Implementation of Allen's interval algebra with meets, overlaps, finishes, and during relations
conversion_notes.duration_theory: Sophisticated duration measurement based on temporal units and concatenation rather than real number mapping
conversion_notes.causality_integration: Critical temporal constraints linking causation, change, and enablement with temporal ordering
conversion_notes.defeasible_reasoning: One axiom (16.55) uses (etc) for defeasible causal modus ponens
conversion_notes.cross_references: Integrates predicates from Chapters 14 (change), 15 (cause, enable, causalComplex), and 12 (scales)
conversion_notes.periodicity_rates: Advanced treatment of temporal patterns including periodicity and rates of occurrence

file_format_notes.axiom_selection: Sample of 17 key axioms representing major concepts - full chapter contains 80 axioms
file_format_notes.section_coverage: Covers temporal topology, eventuality-time relations, temporal ordering, and causal-temporal integration
file_format_notes.complexity_justification: Complex axioms involve multiple nested quantifiers, temporal entity relationships, and sophisticated logical structure
file_format_notes.pattern_focus: Emphasizes type constraints, definitions, and logical constraints characteristic of foundational temporal theory
file_format_notes.owl_time_basis: Based on condensed version of OWL-Time ontology with modifications for commonsense reasoning
